title: Chromosomal Abnormality Diagnosis Simulation: A Constructivist Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Constructivist environment where large learner groups collaborate using smartphone-based VR simulation tools to analyze chromosomal abnormality cases, with formative assessments providing continuous feedback

learning_goals: Learners can accurately diagnose chromosomal abnormalities (Down syndrome, Klinefelter syndrome, etc.) based on actual clinical cases
Learners can explain genotype-phenotype associations and map the cell division stages where meiotic nondisjunction occurs
Learners can explain decision-making processes considering social and ethical implications when diagnosing patients with chromosomal abnormalities

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
